title: Collecting Water from Plant Sap
brief: Extract drinkable water from plants with moist pulpy centers or roots.
steps: Step 1: Identify plants with thick, moist, pulpy centers (like bamboo or thick-stemmed plants).
Step 2: Cut off a section of the plant stem or stalk at the base of a joint.
Step 3: Squeeze or smash the pulp firmly to extract moisture.
Step 4: Catch the liquid in a container or directly in your mouth.
Step 5: For plant roots, dig them out, cut into short pieces, and smash to extract water.
warnings: Do not drink liquid that is sticky, milky, or bitter tasting - it may be poisonous.
Do not keep plant sap longer than 24 hours as it begins fermenting and becomes dangerous.
Avoid plants you cannot positively identify as safe.
